headline: Garlic Shrimp Scampi
description: A family pleaser for years! The more garlic the better for the garlic lovers of the world!

video.description: Buttery and full of delicious garlic, this shrimp is perfect over a bed of noodles with a generous amount of parmesan cheese on top!
video.name: Garlic Shrimp Scampi

name: Garlic Shrimp Scampi

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add angel hair pasta and return pot to boil. Cook until al dente. Drain well.

In a large saucepan, melt butter, saute garlic until tender, remove garlic and discard. Add shrimp and cook until colored pink. Stir in white wine. The bread crumbs are used as thickening, so stir in a little at a time until desired thickness is reached.
Serve shrimp over angel hair pasta, sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.

review.reviewBody: Minor tweaking but don't come at me. I used seasoned panko since this is what I had on hand, it was a game changer. Used extra butter since I had 16oz of pappardelle and used 4 cloves of fresh minced garlic (did not remove). So easy and so flavorful!
Only change was leaving garlic in and a tad more butter. You cannot have too much butter.
I added a sliced red bell pepper, 1/4 cup of heavy cream, a little Italian seasoning and followed the recipe. Served it over spaghetti noodles, it was delicious! Will definitely make it again!
Super yummy! I used chicken broth instead of white wine because that's what I had on hand. I also used minced garlic and left it in. It was really good!
Didn’t remove the garlic. Marinated shrimp with Italian seasonings and onion. Then tossed in butter and wine.
Added more garlic ! You'll love this recipe even more.
Great recipe to start with and tweak to your tastes. I trippled the garlic, did not discard it, added lemon juice, doubled the amount of wine and added a cup of the pasta water.

Absolutely loved this recipe but my daughter and I did do a few things different. We added some lemon juice, red pepper flakes,pinch of salt and pepper. We used a whole stick of butter and we left the garlic in sautéing with the shrimp. The sauce was thinking quickly with the breadcrumbs be sure to save your pasta water!!!
Followed exactly as written...It was like eating pasty oatmeal. Horrible
I added twice the garlic called for and did not discard. Also added one tablespoon lemon juice and would add S&P next time. Tossed with steamed peas and it was great, a hit with the kids too!

The 1/3 cup of wine maybe a little much. I had to use some chicken broth to tweak that bitter taste. I also used some parmesan grated cheese with the bread crumbs to thicken the sauce some. After the adjustments the taste was a lot better for my liking.

So I love garlic so I added 5 cloves of garlic and olive 1/4 cup of olive oil to the mix. Also 2 lbs. of raw shrimp. Was not sure at all about the bread crumbs so only added 1/2 cup and then 1/2 cup of parmigiana, and a tbls. of dried basal as well as 1/2 cup of 1/2 and 1/2 to the mix at the end. My wife couldn't wait, as she kept dipping the Italian bread in the pan at it sautéed at the end. She is a constructive critic at times but this rendition all she kept saying was. OMG this is so good. The bread crumbs in my opinion did help as it soaked up some juice, it produced a creamy buttery cheesy sticky mix. It may take a year off your life, but some things are worth it!!
Made this following the recipe without changes. It was say to and the taste was good. Maybe could have used a little more garlic.
Easy to make and tasted wonderful.

Excellent recipe. Used one pound of shrimp so I cut back on the butter and a little on the bread crumbs. However, before serving I added some olive oil because I thought it might be too dry. That worked.
Loved it!!! I just added more garlic and kept the garlic and butter with it. I also added parsley and Parmesan cheese while in the skillet. You won’t regret trying.
I've made this twice - both times it was a huge hit. The second time I added 1/2 lb mushrooms, 1 zucchini (cut up) and 1 yellow squash (cut up). It was great with the veggies added as well.
This recipe is very, very easy. Clean up was a snap. And it was very good. This will be a usable recipe.. My hubby thought it was very good too. Thanks

I only used 1/2 box of pasta but full recipe of sauce. The sauce definitely needs to be doubled. It coated the pasta but could use more of the sauce. Also be very careful adding the bread crumbs as you don't want it to be thick. We used 6 cloves of garlic as we like the taste - did not remove. Served with a green salad and bread sticks.
I think the 3/4 cup of bread crumbs is too much. I used 1/2 cup and that was even a bit too much. I also add a shrimp scampi spice I had in the cabinet.

Needs some tweaks. First, don't burn the garlic like the video shows. Next, add the wine before the shrimp and cook it down for a few minutes to remove the bitterness of the alcohol. Finally, rather than adding bread crumbs (the thickener) lightly toss the shrimp in flour before adding to the pan. DO NOT overcook the shrimp! Translucent is best. White is overcooked. Somewhere in between is fine for most tastes. Also, add some finely ground white pepper, grated Parmesan cheese, and finely chopped Italian parsley once it's plated.

I made this. I did make some changes. Used more butter and a little less olive oil. I left the garlic in. I had some chopped spinach in the freezer so I added that to give it some color. Used fresh grated Parmesan cheese. Everyone loved it. No leftovers.

I'll definitely make it again.
However, I didn't need near the amount of bread crumbs that was called for in the recipe. I used less than a 1/4 of a cup, adding that just a little at a time and it thickened very nicely. The recipe was flavorful and well worth making.
No. Taste delicious
Very nice, simple, quick meal. I chopped up the garlic and left it in with the shrimp. No need to take it out! I only used half (or so) of the crumbs. My wife and daughter thought it was great.
LEAVE OUT THE Bread Crumbs. The low spices and mushy bread crumbs remind me of nursing home food.

The recipe was very good and very easy to make. I didn't have any white wine so I used chicken broth. I also slowly added the bread crumbs until it was thick enough and didn't use all the bread crumbs. I left in the garlic because I don't see any reason to remove it.
The texture was like oatmeal. The flavor was good. But the texture....
Awesome. I skipped the wine and I don't think it made any difference. Wil definitely make this again.
I don't discard garlic, I love garlic. I also added onions and bits and pieces of green, red, orange and yellow peppers. fresh black peppers, fresh oregano . the aroma in my home was amazing .

Great recipe! I used all the ingredients but had to improvise for the white wine. I combined apple juice with white wine vinegar. I also used parmesan breadcrumbs since that’s all I had. I did add far less breadcrumbs than the recipe called for. You can gauge this while you’re adding the crumbs. Thank you for sharing such a delicious recipe. My husband and I loved it!

I used crushed garlic in olive oil . I also used much less breadcrumbs, probably between a quarter to a half cup. It had great flavor, my husband and I really enjoyed it. And it was such an easy recipe.

Very good recipe. I worried about discarding the garlic too but I decided to smash 4 garlic cloves and cook them in the butter until they started to get brown and removed them to a paper towel. I also cooked some red pepper flakes with the garlic. When I added the wine to the shrimp I also added some lemon juice. I didn’t use very much bread crumbs because I didn’t want it too think. I skipped the cheese altogether because I’m not a fan of cheese with shrimp. It was very garlicky and delicious. I toasted baguette slices and used the smashed garlic to rub on them. My family loved it!
Great with fresh Alaskan shrimp right out of the shrimp pot into the pan. I agree more garlic the better for us garlic lovers!
Followed exactly. Tasty. I left a little garlic in. Please please! Be careful of the bread crumbs. It goes from perfect to beyond thick in a moment.
This was good but not exceptional....not sure why but I was expecting more.

Made this last night using frozen shrimp. It was Great! I added 5 extra garlic cloves, salt and squeeze of lemon juice over top after plating. I will try adding scallions and sauteed mushrooms next time. Thank You!
Used my homegrown garlic!! Easy and yummy!
I would definitely make again
Added extra garlic and less oil.
This was a great recipe. I used lots of garlic. My husband loved it. I will use this recipe many times. We are pasta eaters and love shrimp
I threw in some diced tomatoes and broccoli
I used 3 cloves garlic and used cooking white wine. Turned out excellent. Will make it again and again.
Tasty! We enjoyed it! Very easy to prepare. Added peas to this recipe. Might try asparagus next time. Topping with low sodium soy sauce was good, too.
It was very easy to prepare. I had never used bread crumbs and I will say it was a hit with the family
It was so tasty and everyone loved it.Will be making it once a week Thank you so much

Wow, was that good.

I concur with the others. More garlic, 10 cloves, cut back on the bread crumbs. This needs to be added to create the consistency you like. I used 1/4 cup. Next time I would use a little less. Add a dusting of kosher salt, black pepper and a little crushed red pepper.

For something different, I also added 4 stalks of bias cut asparagus, sauteed while cooking shrimp.

This is one of my all-time quick favorites.
The flavor was great but I found it dry. I would add cream or increase the white wine to make a sauce
Turned out great. Very tasty. Used a little more garlic and I need to cut down some on bread crumbs.

I added some jarred artichoke hearts chopped up and used thin spaghetti instead of angel hair pasta. I also added some dried chives. Basil and/or oregano would have worked as well, I think. The butter sauce was soaked up quickly (probably by the extra seasonings and veg), so next time I will use a little less bread crumb and a little more butter because I like a saucier dish. I think sauteing some diced white onion with the garlic or some sliced green onion later would add some additional interest as well. We served with garlic bread and even my son, who isn't big on seafood, liked it.

Great basis recipe. Used 4 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons olive oil and a lot less bread crumbs. Watch you don't over cook that pasta. So delicious! Just bought extra special scrimp for next time.
Simple and easy.
I thought the sauce needed something. Maybe red pepper flakes? .But it all came together like a charm in just a few minutes.

Dish was really easy to prepare. One problem though and that was that it only took a couple minutes to prepare. WE used precooked shrimp and that cut down on the time. My wife came hoe to the smell of a touch of garlic that was a pleasant surprise, along with dinner being ready when she walked in.
I used this recipe as written and the gang LOVED it!! It was light and delicious, and the plentiful, fresh Gulf shrimp made it "pop!" This will be my very simple, "go-to" shrimp scampi recipe!!

I used spinach pasta and omitted the breadcrumbs because i cant eat gluten. It was fantastic! Mh husband is a Chef at an Italian restaurant and he loved it as well. Full if flavor. I added mushrooms and asparagus tips too.

We used zucchini vegetinni from fresh Italian squash.
We enjoyed very much.

Made this and the family loved it. I made just a few minor tweaks- I added some lemon zest, cracked red peppers and left the garlic. I did lightly season the shrimp for about an hour with some pepper, a little salt and garlic powder. 

I did not have angel hair pasta so I used bow tie pasta.

This recipe is very easy to make.
This was a simple recipe to follow...delicious to eat family loved it, we will make it again
Loved it! Used seasoned breadcrumbs, less than recipe called for.
Very tasty & easy to make.
We really enjoyed it. . Like others I added more garlic and did not discard it. I was amazed at how the bread crumbs thickened it. Will definitely make again
This was wonderful. Will make again and again.
Outstanding recipe. We always add more garlic, and were glad we did.
My husband loved it as well as my grandson.
One of the best scampi recipes I have ever made. I added a bit more garlic because we LOVE garlic. My mom always said we would probably put garlic in banana cream pie--she was not a fan.
One of the best scampi recipes I have ever made. I added a bit more garlic because we LOVE garlic. My mom always said we would probably put garlic in banana cream pie--she was not a fan.
I added crushed red peppers, parsley and more garlic. Cooked pasta with olive oil and kosher salt.
Absolutely yummy! Very easy to make, it's a keeper!
I added sliced mushrooms and cooked them with the shrimp in the butter.
Very bland. Added more garlic and some lemon to cut the greasy butter
no changes ..fast and easy to make loved it !!!
Discard the garlic
Skip the bread crumbs and add more garlic chopped. Leave garlic - do not discard.
Way better if you use reserved pasta water for thickening and sprinkle toasted, buttered breadcrumbs on top. Otherwise a decent recipe. Don’t toss the garlic, though!

I have been making this for years and we love it. I leave the garlic in the sauce because we really like garlic, but I don't use the bread crumbs. They really aren't necessary. I usually serve the scampi over white rice rather than pasta, but it is good either way.
One of my fav shrimp recipes. I also add a slurp of olive oil to the butter to prevent burning. This also allows me to pour it over the pasta for a flavorful sauce.
I did not remove the garlic and added fresh baby spinach, just before taking it off the heat, excellent!
I added pesto to mine and it worked out great!!

I followed another reviewer’s suggestion and marinated the shrimp in the fresh garlic with a couple swigs of olive oil for about an hour before. Other than that, I made as written and it was a big hit with my hubby and teen boys. I will make more sauce next time and perhaps try with angel hair. Served with Jimmbo’s Garlic Knots from this site along with a salad. Will definitely add this recipe to the repertoire!
I love it! I use penne pasta instead of the angle hair though.
Easy, peasy..just Do it!.

I followed another suggestion and marinated the shrimp in the garlic and olive oil while waiting for the water to boil for the pasta. It turned out incredible. I believe that the big thing that I was missing was the bread crumbs.
This recipe was delicious. The only change I made was that I corsely chopped the garlic and kept it in the dish. I also chopped some freah italian parsley to sprinkle ontop! Quick and easy.

This is an excellent recipe. I made the following changes: 1) used 3/4 C butter; 2) used 4 garlic cloves; 3) used 2/3 C wine; 4) added 1/2 C swiss chard, torn into small pieces, and mixed in the hot mixture just until wilted. It gave it a creamier consistency and added color.
I think it needed lemon. I ended up adding it but without that the dish was only so so. I thought the bread crumbs were an interesting twist.
Easy Peasy and loved by the whole family!
Turned out great for the family. I agree a little more garlic makes it quite good. A hit for all!

Made this for my family and they loved it, I changed the recipe a little 1 used chicken broth in place of wine and I mixed a 1/2 teaspoon of corn starch into the chicken both instead of using bread crumbs. I used Penne pasta and double the cheese.

All time favorite shrimp recipe - quick but restaurant quality / company quality meal - just make sure you don't overcook the shrimp - cook only until they are opaque. Better undercooked than over cooked. Love it!
Made a few of the recommended changes (kept the garlic and added extra and added cheese while cooking). Absolutely delicious and so easy.

I gave this 5 stars only because I changed it up a bit , I left some of the garlic in there , how could u get rid of garlic really lol. Plus as to not dry the shrimp out I let the sauce cook first then added the shrimp to it as it only takes a few seconds to cook thru then I added the bread crumbs to thicken the sauce while it finished cooking . That's what I would recommend works best for a simple delish 5 star recipe !!

We loved it! We had minced garlic so used that and of course did not remove garlic. Did not thicken with bread crumbs. Instead just put shredded Parmesan into sauce. We used 1 pound shrimp and 1/2 pound of bay scallops. The only other thing we did was make couscous instead. Everything was delicious. I probably would double the sauce ingredients to stretch in the future.
This was delicious. Will make again but will add more bread crumbs.
Super tasty! I used minced garlic and left it in while cooking. My 5 year old isn't a fan of shrimp and just ate the noodles. He said it was great too!
Delicious...from the reviews I added more garlic mushrooms, lemon juice & white wine & a little red pepper. Glad hubby was willing to help me clean up.

By preparing the garlic in the recipe this way, not much flavor is added. My suggestion would be to crush the garlic (one large clove should be enough) and cook it in the sauce. I also think adding a splash of lemon juice to give the recipe a bit of tartness would help. I also added some capers, which enhanced the flavor. My family loved it prepared this way.

We both liked it....Quick, tasty and versatile all at the same time.
I'll be doing this again.
Too plain for my taste. Way too much bread crumbs. Felt like the bread crumbs over powered the shrimp
